intro: Hemizonia parvula, commonly known as the small-flowered hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in a cluster, and it produces achenes as its fruit. Hemizonia parvula is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
